trans.tranLocal: used to show what a part belongs to or comes from

sentences.tran: 房子的后部
sentences.tranLocal: the back of the house

sentences.tran: 电影的最后一个场景
sentences.tranLocal: the last scene of the movie

sentences.tran: 一天的末了
sentences.tranLocal: the end of the day

trans.tranLocal: used to say that two or more people or things are together in the same place

sentences.tran: 我看到鲍勃与他的女朋友一起在镇上。
sentences.tranLocal: I saw Bob in town with his girlfriend.

sentences.tran: 把这个包和其他的包放在一起。
sentences.tranLocal: Put this bag with the others.

sentences.tran: 这双鞋子我总是和这条裙子一起穿。
sentences.tranLocal: I always wear these shoes with this dress.

sentences.tran: 用开水把粉调和。
sentences.tranLocal: Mix the powder with boiling water.

sentences.tran: 你最好把护照带着。
sentences.tranLocal: You’d better bring your passport with you.

phrases.tran: 利用，处理；需要；忍受；与……相处
v. 伴随；与…相配；和交朋友

trans.tranLocal: used to say exactly where something or someone is, or where something happens

sentences.tran: 他们住在维多利亚街18 号。
sentences.tranLocal: They live at 18 Victoria Street.

sentences.tran: 这列火车在普雷斯顿停吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Does this train stop at Preston?

sentences.tran: 我在公共汽车站等着。
sentences.tranLocal: I was waiting at the bus stop.

sentences.tran: 莉兹和她的朋友在靠角落的一张桌子旁坐下。
sentences.tranLocal: Liz and her friend sat down at a corner table.

sentences.tran: 在教堂那里朝左转。
sentences.tranLocal: Turn left at the church.

sentences.tran: 我们将在哈里家碰头。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ll meet at Harry’s (=  at Harry’s house  ) .

sentences.tran: 我在牙医诊所度过了难熬的一小时。
sentences.tranLocal: I spent an unpleasant hour at the dentist’s.

sentences.tran: 爸爸在上班。
sentences.tranLocal: Dad’s at work (=  in the place where he works  ) .

phrases.tran: [口语]争吵；重复负面消极的行为(此语亦可含有与性行为有关的意思)

trans.tranLocal: to the inside or inner part of a container, place, area etc

sentences.tran: 到办公室里来。
sentences.tranLocal: Come into the office.

sentences.tran: 他把手插进大衣口袋里。
sentences.tranLocal: He thrust his hand into his coat pocket.

sentences.tran: 一定有其他的路可以进入洞穴。
sentences.tranLocal: There must be another way into the cave.

sentences.tran: 休回到床上，拉过被子蒙住头。
sentences.tranLocal: Sue got back into bed and pulled the quilt over her head.

sentences.tran: 我今天上午得进城去。
sentences.tranLocal: I’ve got to go into town this morning.

sentences.tran: 我们跳进海里。
sentences.tranLocal: We dived into the sea.

trans.tranLocal: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

sentences.tran: 夏天她当过救生员。
sentences.tranLocal: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.

sentences.tran: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。
sentences.tranLocal: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.

sentences.tran: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。
sentences.tranLocal: Foxes remain hidden during the day.

trans.tranLocal: used to introduce something or someone that is part of a larger group or amount you have just mentioned

sentences.tran: 价钱是25.5英镑，含邮费和包装费。
sentences.tranLocal: The price is £25.50, including postage and packing.

sentences.tran: 你将需要各种技巧，包括领导能力和协商能力。
sentences.tranLocal: You’ll need a variety of skills, including leadership and negotiating.

trans.tranLocal: if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time

sentences.tran: 这张票的有效期一直到 3 月份。
sentences.tranLocal: The ticket is valid until March.

sentences.tran: 他一直等到她讲完。
sentences.tranLocal: He waited until she had finished speaking.

sentences.tran: 直到最近，安娜一直在日本当老师。
sentences.tranLocal: Until recently, Anna worked as a teacher in Japan.

sentences.tran: 一直到去年，他们连汽车也没有。
sentences.tranLocal: Up until last year, they didn’t even own a car.

trans.tranLocal: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support

sentences.tran: 有一把梯子靠在墙边。
sentences.tranLocal: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.

sentences.tran: 那位较年轻的警官两臂交叉，倚靠在办公桌旁。
sentences.tranLocal: The younger policeman was leaning against the bureau with his arms folded.

phrases.tran: 在…对面；正对着；与…相反；与…形成对照

trans.tranLocal: in or through the middle of a group of people or things

sentences.tran: 女孩转眼消失在人群中。
sentences.tranLocal: The girl quickly disappeared among the crowd.

sentences.tran: 我能听到灌木丛中某个地方传来说话的声音。
sentences.tranLocal: I could hear voices coming from somewhere among the bushes.

sentences.tran: 我们走在山坡上的栗树林中。
sentences.tranLocal: We walked among the chestnut woods on the mountain slopes.

sentences.tran: 她开始在桌子上的一堆书中乱翻起来。
sentences.tranLocal: She began rummaging among the books on her desk.

phrases.tran: 其中；尤其；除了别的之外

trans.tranLocal: in every part of a particular area, place etc

sentences.tran: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构
sentences.tranLocal: a large organization with offices throughout the world

sentences.tran: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。
sentences.tranLocal: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.

sentences.tran: 这幢房子状况极好，全部铺着地毯。
sentences.tranLocal: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.

trans.tranLocal: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

sentences.tran: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。
sentences.tranLocal: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.

trans.tranLocal: money put, saved, or given towards something is used to pay for it

sentences.tran: 募集到的钱款将用于修缮教堂屋顶。
sentences.tranLocal: The money collected will be put towards repairing the church roof.

trans.tranLocal: used to mean ‘on’ or ‘onto’

sentences.tran: 授予该协会的荣誉
sentences.tranLocal: an honour bestowed upon the association

sentences.tran: 我们完全依赖你的帮助。
sentences.tranLocal: We are completely dependent upon your help.

sentences.tran: 布兰登把他摔倒在地。
sentences.tranLocal: Brandon threw him upon the ground.

trans.tranLocal: about or relating to

sentences.tran: 小孩子打来的有关宠物走失的电话
sentences.tranLocal: calls from young children concerning lost pets

sentences.tran: 有关马尔撞车事故的事实
sentences.tranLocal: the facts concerning Marr’s car crash

phrases.tran: ◎从事,忙于(常与with, about, in, over连用)
对…表示担心/忧虑；使（自己）关心…
adj. 干预；从事（参与；从事参与）；干涉

trans.tranLocal: if a door is pushed to, it closes or almost closes

trans.tran: 到；向；（表示时间、方向）朝…方向
trans.tranLocal: used to say where someone or something goes

trans.tran: (To)人名；(柬)多；(中)脱(普通话·威妥玛)

sentences.tran: 风把门吹上了。
sentences.tranLocal: The wind blew the door to.

trans.tranLocal: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is

sentences.tran: 碗橱里有一些糖。
sentences.tranLocal: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.

sentences.tran: 我母亲在厨房里。
sentences.tranLocal: My mother was in the kitchen.

sentences.tran: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。
sentences.tranLocal: He took us for a drive in his new car.

sentences.tran: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。
sentences.tranLocal: I found her sitting up in bed.

sentences.tran: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。
sentences.tranLocal: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.

sentences.tran: 地上的一个洞
sentences.tranLocal: a hole in the ground

sentences.tran: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。
sentences.tranLocal: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.

sentences.tran: 我父母现住在新西兰。
sentences.tranLocal: My parents live in New Zealand now.

phrases.tran: 在工作或娱乐中总是马不停蹄
作为感谢、致敬或表示尊重

list.tran: 向内的；内部的；精神的；本质上的；熟悉的
内心的；最里面的，最深处的；秘密的
心底的，内心深处的；最深的

trans.tranLocal: used to say who is intended to get or use something, or where something is intended to be used

sentences.tran: 我有件礼物送给你。
sentences.tranLocal: I’ve got a present for you.

sentences.tran: 有人给维基留了言。
sentences.tranLocal: Someone left a message for Vicky.

sentences.tran: 为外国学生开的一门英语课程
sentences.tranLocal: an English course for foreign students

sentences.tran: 我们的收音机需要一节新电池。
sentences.tranLocal: We need a new battery for the radio.

sentences.tran: 这些椅子是办公室的。
sentences.tranLocal: These chairs are for the office.

phrases.tran: 打算；在选举中被提名；在法庭受审；被关押
举个例说；作为其中一个
去找；被认为；主张；拥护；努力获取

trans.tranLocal: used to say what part of someone or something is hit or touched

sentences.tran: 我真想一拳打到他鼻子上。
sentences.tranLocal: I wanted to punch him on the nose.

sentences.tran: 马特亲吻了她的脸颊。
sentences.tranLocal: Matt kissed her on the cheek.

trans.tranLocal: used especially with a  passive  verb to say who or what does something or makes something happen

sentences.tran: 我被一条狗袭击。
sentences.tranLocal: I was attacked by a dog.

sentences.tran: 著名建筑师克里斯托弗·雷恩爵士设计的一座教堂
sentences.tranLocal: a church designed by the famous architect, Sir Christopher Wren

sentences.tran: 我们都对暴力罪案的增加感到忧虑。
sentences.tranLocal: We are all alarmed by the rise in violent crime.

sentences.tran: 国家对教会事务的干预
sentences.tranLocal: interference by the state in the affairs of the Church

sentences.tran: 英国广播公司委任他为制片人
sentences.tranLocal: his appointment by the BBC as a producer

trans.tranLocal: concerning or relating to a particular subject

sentences.tran: 一本有关政治的书
sentences.tranLocal: a book about politics

sentences.tran: 她说了些要离开镇子的话。
sentences.tranLocal: She said something about leaving town.

sentences.tran: 他谎报年龄。
sentences.tranLocal: He lied about his age.

sentences.tran: 说到你的那辆车，你打算卖什么价钱？
sentences.tranLocal: About that car of yours. How much are you selling it for?

sentences.tran: 他在说什么呀？
sentences.tranLocal: What’s he on about (=  talking about  ) ?

sentences.tran: 医生，是汤米，他又病了。
sentences.tranLocal: It’s about Tommy, doctor. He’s been sick again.

sentences.tran: 很自然，我母亲想知道事情的全部。
sentences.tranLocal: Naturally, my mother wanted to know all about it (=  all the details relating to it  ) .

phrases.tran: 处理；应付；就某事采取行动或措施
v. 着手做；四处走动；传开；从事

trans.tranLocal: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good

sentences.tran: 我喜欢你这件上衣。
sentences.tranLocal: I like your jacket.

sentences.tran: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。
sentences.tranLocal: I don’t really like classical music.

sentences.tran: 你喜欢这种颜色吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Do you like this colour?

sentences.tran: 我喜欢喝很淡的咖啡。
sentences.tranLocal: I like my coffee quite weak.

sentences.tran: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。
sentences.tranLocal: I don’t like it when you get angry.

sentences.tran: 住在伦敦你感觉怎样？
sentences.tranLocal: How do you like living in London (= how much do you like it )?

sentences.tran: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。
sentences.tranLocal: I quite like their new album.

sentences.tran: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。
sentences.tranLocal: We really liked the film.

sentences.tran: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。
sentences.tranLocal: The time I like best (= like most of all ) is the evening when it’s cool.

sentences.tran: 我可不想当单亲家长。
sentences.tranLocal: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.

phrases.tran: 如果你愿意；如果你喜欢的话
没有什么能比得上；一点也不象
毫不费力地；轻而易举地；完美地
[口]拼命地；非常猛地；全力地；象什么似的
喜欢做某事（特指某一次）

list.tran: 很可能的；合适的；有希望的
令人喜爱的，可爱的（等于likable）
相似，相像；样子，肖像；照片，画像；相似物

trans.tranLocal: because of something

sentences.tran: 去年因为员工生病损失了多少个工作日？
sentences.tranLocal: How many working days were lost through sickness last year?

phrases.tran: 参加；经受；仔细检查；被通过
一路走过（歌词）；经过所有（歌词）

list.tran: [公路] 高速公路，[公路] 直达道路

trans.tranLocal: above or higher than something, without touching it

sentences.tran: 一盏灯悬挂在桌子上方。
sentences.tranLocal: A lamp hung over the table.

sentences.tran: 她身子探过桌面接电话。
sentences.tranLocal: She leaned over the desk to answer the phone.

sentences.tran: 门上方的警示牌写着“小心碰头”。
sentences.tranLocal: The sign over the door said ‘Mind your head’.

sentences.tran: 我们看着一架直升机在港口低空飞行。
sentences.tranLocal: We watched a helicopter flying low over the harbour.

phrases.tran: 到处，遍及；浑身；全部结束
复习，重温；仔细检查；转变；润色
adv. 一再地；反复不断地
招待某人在家吃饭 (或饮酒等)
在…对面；正对着；与…相反；与…形成对照
煎半熟蛋；煎两面；结束容易

list.tran: 过于老化；商品过剩；人工时效过度

trans.tranLocal: earlier than something or someone

sentences.tran: 这条新公路应该在年底前完工。
sentences.tranLocal: The new road should be completed before the end of the year.

sentences.tran: 看演出前在我们家碰头吧。
sentences.tranLocal: Let’s meet at our house before the show.

sentences.tran: 拉里在我之前到家。
sentences.tranLocal: Larry arrived home before me.

sentences.tran: 我们前天才从苏格兰回来。
sentences.tranLocal: We only got back from Scotland the day before yesterday (=  two days ago  ) .

sentences.tran: 其他学生也加入了抗议队伍，不久就有200人左右了。
sentences.tranLocal: Other students joined in the protest, and before long (=  soon  ) there was a crowd of 200 or so.

sentences.tran: 他在两餐之间吃点东西来补充正餐。
sentences.tranLocal: He supplements his regular meals by eating between meals.

sentences.tran: 这些实验的目的就是探索这两种现象之间的联系，如果存在着任何联系的话。
sentences.tranLocal: The object of these experiments was to find the connection, if any, between the two phenomena.

phrases.tran: 只限于咱俩之间；我们之间的秘密
只限于咱们之间；秘密的

trans.tranLocal: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something

sentences.tran: 战后，许多士兵留在法国。
sentences.tranLocal: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.

sentences.tran: 我每天下班后都去游泳。
sentences.tranLocal: I go swimming every day after work.

sentences.tran: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Do you believe in life after death?

sentences.tran: 刚过午夜，第一波进攻开始了。
sentences.tranLocal: The first attack started just after midnight.

sentences.tran: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。
sentences.tranLocal: David went to bed straight after (=  immediately after  ) supper.

sentences.tran: 报警之后，你做了些什么？
sentences.tranLocal: After you’d called the police, what did you do?

sentences.tran: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。
sentences.tranLocal: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.

sentences.tran: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。
sentences.tranLocal: People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after (=  happened after it  ) .

list.tran: 最后的；最后部的；最靠近船尾的

trans.tran: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

trans.tranLocal: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

sentences.tran: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.

sentences.tran: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。
sentences.tranLocal: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.

sentences.tran: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。
sentences.tranLocal: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.

sentences.tran: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。
sentences.tranLocal: The factory has been here since the 1970s.

sentences.tran: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。
sentences.tranLocal: It was exactly five years since her father had died.

sentences.tran: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。
sentences.tranLocal: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.

sentences.tran: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。
sentences.tranLocal: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.

sentences.tran: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。
sentences.tranLocal: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.

sentences.tran: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。
sentences.tranLocal: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.

phrases.tran: 自什么时候起，打什么时候开始

trans.tranLocal: not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary

trans.tran: 户外；在外面；没有或不显示某事物

sentences.tran: 暴风雨之后我们断电了五天。
sentences.tranLocal: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.

sentences.tran: 不带花园的房子
sentences.tranLocal: a house without a garden

sentences.tran: 我们路过两座破落的寺院，一座有塔楼，另一座没有。
sentences.tranLocal: We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.

sentences.tran: 我已经习惯没有汽车了。
sentences.tranLocal: I’m getting used to managing without a car.

trans.tranLocal: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Under is also an adverb

sentences.tran: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。
sentences.tranLocal: These toys are not suitable for children under five.

sentences.tran: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。
sentences.tranLocal: Most of the events listed cost under £60.

sentences.tran: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。
sentences.tranLocal: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.

sentences.tran: 他在钻下水前深深地吸了口气。
sentences.tranLocal: He took a deep breath before he went under.

phrases.tran: vt. 破产；沉没；屈服；失败
叠排式；（商品损耗量的）波动量；立式双筒短枪

list.tran: 后进生；学校学习成绩低于智商的学生
出价低于…；出较低的价钱

trans.tranLocal: before a certain period of time has passed

sentences.tran: 我们24小时之内应该可以拿到化验结果。
sentences.tranLocal: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.

sentences.tran: 他病倒了，不出几星期就死了。
sentences.tranLocal: He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.

sentences.tran: 我们到达还没有一小时，卡罗琳就开始抱怨了。
sentences.tranLocal: Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.

trans.tranLocal: going forward
from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it

sentences.tran: 我一边开车，一边想着克里斯。
sentences.tranLocal: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.

sentences.tran: 排着队向前走的一群孩子
sentences.tranLocal: a group of children walking along in a line

phrases.tran: 沿（顺）着；连同…一起；与…一道；随同…一起
（勉强）生活；进展；（使）前进；与…和睦相处
v. 出现；一起来；陪伴；进步
沽名钓誉的；(在团体中)图虚名而不做工作的；逢场作戏；陪伴
在那个方向，朝那个方向
在这个方向，朝这个方向

trans.tranLocal: You use following to refer to something that you are about to mention

sentences.tran: 写下以下信息：产品名称、型号、购买日期和价格。
sentences.tranLocal: Write down the following information: name of product, type, date purchased and price.

list.tran: 跟随；遵循；追求；密切注意

phrases.tran: 全面地；包括一切地；以三等分的钱数赌同一匹马赢得前三名

trans.tranLocal: at or towards the back of a thing or person

sentences.tran: 我转身和站在我后面的那人说话。
sentences.tranLocal: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.

sentences.tran: 很可能有人跟在我们后面。
sentences.tranLocal: Someone could easily creep up behind us.

sentences.tran: 后面那辆车不耐烦地按着喇叭。
sentences.tranLocal: The car behind was hooting impatiently.

sentences.tran: 简随手关上身后的门。
sentences.tranLocal: Jane shut the door behind her.

sentences.tran: 经理坐在一张大办公桌的后面。
sentences.tranLocal: The manager was sitting behind a large desk.

trans.tranLocal: more or greater than a particular amount, level, or limit

sentences.tran: 越来越多的人选择过了退休年龄继续工作。
sentences.tranLocal: More people are choosing to work beyond retirement age.

sentences.tran: 通货膨胀已经超出了5%的水平。
sentences.tranLocal: Inflation has risen beyond the 5% level.

phrases.tran: [主英国口语]极远的地方；天涯海角；穷乡僻壤，僻远的地区，极偏僻的地方，内地(尤指澳大利亚内陆的荒野地带)

trans.tranLocal: a  plus sign
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures
used to show that one number or amount is added to another

sentences.tran: 白天的气温仅零上5度。
sentences.tranLocal: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.

phrases.tran: (高尔夫球比赛中强者对弱者的)让一分，让一击

sentences.tran: 除了我以外他们都在那里。
sentences.tranLocal: They were all there except me.

sentences.tran: 除他以外， 我们都去了。
sentences.tranLocal: We all went except him.

sentences.tran: 除了我以外，他们全都哈哈大笑起来。
sentences.tranLocal: They all howled with laughter except me.

list.tran: 可反对的；可抗议的；引起反感的

trans.tranLocal: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one

sentences.tran: 这是一辆旧车，但是性能非常可靠。
sentences.tranLocal: It’s an old car, but it’s very reliable.

sentences.tran: 他们急忙赶到医院，但是已经太迟了。
sentences.tranLocal: They rushed to the hospital, but they were too late.

sentences.tran: 我们邀请过老板，但她有可能决定不来。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ve invited the boss, but she may decide not to come.

sentences.tran: 价钱很贵却是非常有用的一本书
sentences.tranLocal: an expensive but extremely useful book

sentences.tran: “他有经验吗？”“没有，但他非常好学。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Has he got any experience?’ ‘No, but he’s keen to learn.’

phrases.tran: [美国口语]彻底地，完全；狠狠地；有力地；毫无疑问

trans.tranLocal: towards a higher place or position
If you are up, you are not in bed

sentences.tran: 我们慢慢地爬上山。
sentences.tranLocal: We walked slowly up the hill.

sentences.tran: 她从地板上捡起外套。
sentences.tranLocal: She picked her jacket up off the floor.

sentences.tran: 通往山里的小径
sentences.tranLocal: paths leading up into the mountains

sentences.tran: 蒂姆爬到了树上，以便看得更清楚。
sentences.tranLocal: Tim had climbed up a tree to get a better view.

sentences.tran: 如果知道答案就举手。
sentences.tranLocal: Put up your hand if you know the answer.

sentences.tran: 水已经没到了我的鼻子。
sentences.tranLocal: The water was getting up my nose.

sentences.tran: 卡伦仰卧着，盯着天花板。
sentences.tranLocal: Karen lay on her back, staring up at the ceiling.

sentences.tran: 你肯定你该起床了吗?
sentences.tranLocal: Are you sure you should be up?

sentences.tran: 这些天他们在破晓时就起床。
sentences.tranLocal: These days they were up at the crack of dawn.

phrases.tran: 上上下下；到处；前前后后；来来往往

trans.tranLocal: from inside an object, container, building, or place

sentences.tran: 她打开手提箱，拿出一双鞋。
sentences.tranLocal: She opened her suitcase and took out a pair of shoes.

sentences.tran: 你出去时把门锁上。
sentences.tranLocal: Lock the door on your way out.

sentences.tran: 夏洛特走到窗前往外看。
sentences.tranLocal: Charlotte went to the window and looked out.

sentences.tran: 你给我出去！
sentences.tranLocal: Out you go (= used to order someone to leave a room )!

phrases.tran: 由于；缺乏；自…离开；用…（材料）
寻求；[口]力图要；决心要获得

list.tran: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
外面的，外部的；远离中心的
最远的；最外面的；最高头的
向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
远足；短途旅游；体育比赛

sentences.tran: 她对于她周围所有的人是一种多么大的鼓舞!
sentences.tranLocal: What an inspiration she was to all around her!

sentences.tran: 周围的人都对他投射出惊异的眼光。
sentences.tranLocal: All those around him looked at him with amazement.

phrases.tran: 四处走动；供应；（消息）流传
[美口]阅历多；老于世故；遍布各地

trans.tranLocal: to or towards a lower place or position

sentences.tran: 戴维弯腰系鞋带。
sentences.tranLocal: David bent down to tie his shoelace.

sentences.tran: 从桌子上下来。
sentences.tranLocal: Get down off the table.

sentences.tran: 我泪流满面。
sentences.tranLocal: Tears were streaming down my face.

sentences.tran: 夕阳西下，天很快就要黑了。
sentences.tranLocal: The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.

sentences.tran: 他们跑下楼来。
sentences.tranLocal: They came running down the stairs.

sentences.tran: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。
sentences.tranLocal: She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.

sentences.tran: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单，注意到了一个熟悉的名字。
sentences.tranLocal: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.

sentences.tran: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。
sentences.tranLocal: Her hair came down to her waist.

sentences.tran: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。
sentences.tranLocal: Ken fell asleep face down (= with his face towards the ground ) on the couch.

phrases.tran: 下降；平静下来；传下去；被接受
彻底地，完全；在一切方面
贫困潦倒的；被击倒不能再战的
(股票市场上) 与…相比下跌
[澳大利亚、新西兰英语](尤指在不需要的时候或抢在别人前面)获得某物
等到最后一刻才开始做事，最后关头
把某人请来作客(从城市到农村，从河流上游到下游，从北到南等用 down，反之 用 up)

list.tran: 柔和的；绒毛的；多丘岗的

trans.tranLocal: used to say how much of something someone has

sentences.tran: 你的体育运动装备够不够？
sentences.tranLocal: How are you off for sports equipment? (= do you have enough? )

phrases.tran: [英国俚语]从头开始；从起点开始，从一开始

list.tran: 冷漠的；不亲热的；疏远的

sentences.tran: 他住在那商店上面的一套房间里。
sentences.tranLocal: He lived in a flat above the shop.

sentences.tran: 大型客机在云层上面飞行。
sentences.tranLocal: The airliner flew above the clouds.

phrases.tran: 自高自大；趾高气扬；兴高采烈
变得自高自大；自视甚高

trans.tranLocal: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

sentences.tran: 他们住在伦敦附近。
sentences.tranLocal: They live near London.

sentences.tran: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。
sentences.tranLocal: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.

sentences.tran: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。
sentences.tranLocal: They moved house to be nearer the school.

sentences.tran: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。
sentences.tranLocal: She told the children not to go near the canal.

sentences.tran: 我警告你别再靠近！
sentences.tranLocal: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!

sentences.tran: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。
sentences.tranLocal: We heard voices as we drew near the village.

phrases.tran: 走进；险些；可与…相比（多用于否定句）
